title: Lifetime error's span is extremely unhelpful

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

body:
# Without explicit lifetime
```
error[E0621]: explicit lifetime required in the type of `expr`
   --> typescript/checker/src/analyzer/expr.rs:14:84
    |
14  |       pub(super) fn type_of<'e>(&'e self, expr: &Expr) -> Result<TypeRef<'e>, Error> {
    |  _______________________________________________-----________________________________^
    | |                                               |
    | |                                               help: add explicit lifetime `'e` to the type of `expr`: `&'e swc_ecma_ast::Expr`
15  | |         let span = expr.span();
16  | |
17  | |         match *expr {
...   |
340 | |         }
341 | |     }
    | |_____^ lifetime `'e` required


```


# With explicit lifetime
```
error[E0623]: lifetime mismatch
   --> typescript/checker/src/analyzer/expr.rs:14:91
    |
14  |       pub(super) fn type_of<'e, 'a>(&'e self, expr: &'a Expr) -> Result<TypeRef<'e>, Error> {
    |  ___________________________________________________--------_____--------------------------_^
    | |                                                   |
    | |                                                   this parameter and the return type are declared with different lifetimes...
15  | |         let span = expr.span();
16  | |
17  | |         match *expr {
...   |
340 | |         }
341 | |     }
    | |_____^ ...but data from `expr` is returned here


```

Error's span points the whole function, and in my case, it's 300 lines.
